info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 1:35PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Colorado, including the following county, Mesa. * WHEN...Until 445 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 131 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms about 10 miles east of Gateway just south of Highway 141. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.6 and 0.9 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Bear Creek, Fall Creek, Calamity Creek, Big Dominguez Creek, Gill Creek and Beaver Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... areas along and south of Highway 141 located about 10 miles east of Gateway and across mainly rural areas of Southwestern Mesa County
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
